times-up.Debug.Name: Debug
times-up.Debug.Hint: Choose the amount of debug to display
times-up.TimesUpEnabled.Name: Enable Times Up
times-up.TimesUpEnabled.Hint: Enable Auto expiry and modification of effects. The changes to passive effects require this enabled
times-up.EnablePassiveEffects.Name: Set start for transfer effects
times-up.EnablePassiveEffects.Hint: When an expired active effect is enabled update it's start time to the current world/combat time
times-up.UpdatePassiveEffects.Name: Update passive effects
times-up.UpdatePassiveEffects.Hint: The duration type of passive effects will be changed to rounds/seconds if the token is in (or enters) combat/leaves combat. See also below
times-up.MaxRoundsToConvert.Name: Max rounds to convert
times-up.MaxRoundsToConvert.Hint: If the duration in seconds (remaining duration for non transfer effects) is <= this number of rounds it will be converted to rounds for combat
times-up.ExpireRoundEffectsOnCombatEnd.N: Expire rounds/turns duration effects on combat end
times-up.ExpireRoundEffectsOnCombatEnd.H: When combat ends, expire all effects that have a duration in rounds/turns. Short-term combat effects will be removed when combat ends.
times-up.EffectQueueManager.Name: Effect Queue Manager
times-up.EffectQueueManager.Label: Open Effect Queue Manager
times-up.EffectQueueManager.SettingsHint: View and manage the effect expiration queue
times-up.EffectQueueManager.Title: Times Up - Effect Queue Manager
times-up.EffectQueueManager.Hint: This shows all effects currently tracked for expiration. You can remove entries from the queue (the effect itself is not deleted).
times-up.EffectQueueManager.EmptyQueue: No effects in the expiration queue
times-up.EffectQueueManager.ConfirmDelet: Are you sure you want to remove all effects from the expiration queue? This will prevent Times Up from automatically expiring these effects.
